alert.note: Alert for Greater Portland Metro Area (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 23 at 12:47AM PST until February 23 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow at times. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph, especially near the Gorge. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 5 above zero. * WHERE...Greater Portland Metro Area. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 8 AM PST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until noon PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Snow covered roads will linger into the Thursday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Expect snow to increase again by 130 AM across most of the metro area, producing another 1 to 3 inches of accumulation on top of what has already fallen.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
